Articles.Content:
Welcome to the Mir Challenge.

The goal of this challenge is straight forward. Build a replica of Mir using stock parts.

Rules:

DLCs are allowed

No part mods allowed.

KER and Mechjeb are allowed, but you can't use the autopilot for any part of the mission.

No cheating or hyperedit.

Modules and launchers must be of your own design.

 

Launch Order:

Mir Core Module: 1986 Proton K

Kvant-1: 1987 Proton K

Kvant-2:  1989 Proton K

Kristall: 1990 Proton K

Spektr: 1995 Proton K

Docking Module: 1995 Space Shuttle

Priroda: 1995 Proton K

 

 

 

Modes:

Easiest Mode: Build Mir, modules can be constructed in any order, any orbit, and can be launched in anyway you want.

Easy Mode: Build Mir but modules need to be built in the order they were in real life. Yourr space station can be in any orbit,, and can be launched in anyway you want.

Normal Mode: Build Mir, in the correct order as in real life, but with the rockets that launched the modules, as in the Proton and the Space Shuttle. Can be in any orbit you want.

Pro Mode: Build Mir, in the correct order as in real life, using replicas of the rockets that launched the modules, as in the Proton and the Space Shuttle, but needs to be in the same orbit as Mir. (Orbital Specs: Ap: 370-380 km Pe: 350-360 km Inclination: 50-55 degrees).

 

Bonus Missions:

STS-63: Fly your replica space shuttle to within 11 meters of your space station.

Buran: Build a replica of Buran, and fly it to orbit and back.

Salyut: Build a replica of Salyut 7, the last space station before Mir.

Badges coming soon!

 

Edited September 23, 2019 by DunaManiac
Could you supply us with the launch order of the modules?
